data.title: Very nice breakfast
data.text: Nice quiet place for breakfast. Service was attentive but not too much so this could be a good place for a business meal too.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text:
The place is Really nice. Right in Downtown Seattle in Renaissance Hotel. Service was great we were escorted by the host to the table where the waitress met us and took care of our orders. 
My only comment will be that the buffet is too small for a big restaurant like this one and as for the choices they could have a lot more.

data.title: Excellent buffet breakfast but very expensive lunch menu
data.text: Service was good which it should have been considering this property automatically adds a 20% gratuity for all meals.  Buffet breakfast is excellent with a nice variety of options.  The lunch menu is very expensive for what is served.  The restaurant offers a lot of nice natural light with nice views outside the hotel.

data.title: Terrible
data.text: Weather was terrible so we decided to do Maxwell's dinner at the bar downstairs.  I will say my husband's salmon and vegetables were good, but the rice pilaf was nasty.  The bread was so hard it was inedible.  My cup of chowder was very watery and the lamb sliders so bad I had to brush my teeth immediately upon returning to my room.  I would not eat here if it was free!

data.title: Brunch was mediocre at best
data.text: Had brunch here the last morning of our stay. For the price the buffet was pretty mediocre, I had one of the menu items and it was pretty gross- tasted like it was frozen are reheated.

data.title: Excellent Service
data.text: Our waiter, I believe his name was Michael was there when we needed him and gave excellent service. Although we ordered breakfast off of the menu he told us we could go get fresh fruit and juice off of the buffet if we wanted to. (we did). Also gave us a refill of our drink to go when we were ready to leave. It was nice to be given these options when we weren't expecting it. Great place. I'll go there the next time I stay at the Renaissance Hotel.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Simple breakfast choices, which were okay. I ordered the "corned beef hash" breakfast. I understand that corned beef is fairly fatty, but having to push off to the side of my plate, about three tablespoons of just fat (hidden under eggs) was a bit much. They need to be more cognizant of what's leaving their kitchen.

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: We stopped by Maxwells every single day for breakfast and it was top notch!  Kids 5 and under eat free at the buffet with a paying adult and their menu items are no slouch either!  They've got great pancakes, waffles, and french toast.  All served with fresh, seasonal fruit and whipped butter.  And the breakfast buffet offers plenty of variety.  Lastly, their coffee is fantastic and the staff even offered me a to-go cup so that I could take some with me.  We were very happy with their service!

data.title: The Food was Good
data.text: The restaurant was quiet, and nice. The service was excellent, mostly because he was very helpful. The menu was limited, but what we chose was OK. The food was good, but nothing special. A good place to eat since it was conveniently located at the hotel.

data.title: Decent, but nothing special
data.text:
Ate here on a Sunday evening for dinner. Small menu. Fair prices. Good service (but we were only diners in place for awhile, so no real stress on the wait staff). Decent wine selection. Food competently prepared. 
This is a hotel restaurant and ranks in middle of the pack. We got there at 5:00 PM as it opened and had the place to ourselves (big family) for awhile.

data.title: Convenient resturant located in the hotel.
data.text: Having this in the hotel was great. The food was good but there was a limited selection. They had a much better room service menu.

data.title: Very good breakfast, albeit a tad bit expensive
data.text: We stayed at the hotel and inside of venturing out for breakfast we ate at the hotel. It was a good breakfast albeit it was expensive.

data.title: Great breakfast buffet
data.text: The breakfast buffet at Maxwells is one of the best, with a little bit of everything.  You can get eggs to order, omelets, waffles, and a wide array of breakfast items.  The coffee is good and the service is very friendly and fast.  It is a good spot to stop in, and order off the menu as well, with a lot of other options besides the buffet.

data.title: Best option for breakfast in this part of downtown
data.text: Great food- huge portions suggest splitting a plate! Excellent service. Walked around trying to find a local place and was disappointed with options in the area for breakfast. Came back to the hotel to realize we shouldn't have left! We had some huge pancakes and the coffee was good. Service was high class and friendly. Quick to seat and to receive food as well! Highly recommend!

data.title: A quiet lunch
data.text:
My wife and I ate a late lunch at Maxwell's because we had a two-for-one coupon.  The dinning room was relatively empty, and we got a table by the window that had a pleasant view.  From my seat I could look out on the Central Library.  I found the lunch menu a bit limited.  We ended up ordering the crab sliders, which were tasty and a decent value with the coupon.  

The restaurant imposes a mandatory 20% service charge, which I find annoying.  I tip generously but would not have chosen that degree of generosity given the friendly but indifferent service we received.

data.title: Have to try the breakfast waffle!,
data.text: Breakfast came with our room due to being gold member which included the full buffet which was very good but we had our son with us so I ordered off the menu and had the waffle covered with fresh fruit. It was awesome!!  Can't wait to eat breakfast here again. We also ate dinner one evening after a long day of Christmas shopping n being too tired to go out to eat and the food was excellent.

data.title: Great service
data.text: We ate here on out last night at the hotel. Service was spot on without being overwhelming. Steak Frits was perfectly cooked. Was one of the better restaurants we ate at in the immediate area of the hotel.

data.title: GREAT SERVICE
data.text: Our reservations at the Renaissance came with a coupon for a free breakfast at Maxwells.  We had a great experience.  The food was wonderful and the service was simply unbeatable.  All of the staff were very attentive and provided service that exceeded our expectations.  We'll go here again.  It's that good.  I usually am not a fan of hotel food, but this place is different.  The food is good. The atmosphere is wonderful.  What makes it so special really is the staff and how good they are at their jobs.  Thank you Maxwells.

data.title: Great service and good food
data.text: Great service, good food. I ate both breakfast and lunch there. Breakfast was buffet and included with the room. The salmon sandwich I had at lunch was terrific. Much needed after traveling. Staff very friendly.

data.title: outstanding service and food
data.text: Excellent service and delicious and fresh food. Returned several times. Easy, quick and well done. Salad and fish were outstanding.
